N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 401.4 - Public review of proposed comprehensive annual social services program plan

State Regulations
(a) The proposed
comprehensive annual social services program plan will be submitted to the
commissioner of the department so that it may be approved, published and made
generally available to the public by the commissioner on or before the first
day of July. (b) The department
will prepare a detailed summary of the proposed comprehensive annual social
services program plan and provide copies thereof to the social services
district prior to publication of the proposed plan by the commissioner. Beginning on the date of publication of the proposed plan by the commissioner
and continuing throughout the period for public comment, the department and the
social services district shall, upon request, distribute copies of the detailed
summary to interested individuals or organizations without charge. (c) The department will provide copies of the
proposed comprehensive annual social services program plan to the social
services district prior to publication of the proposed plan by the Governor. The department and the social services district shall make copies of the
proposed comprehensive annual social services program plan available for
inspection by the public commencing with the date of publication and continuing
throughout the program year. The department will also make copies of the
proposed comprehensive annual social services program plan available for
purchase at a price related to cost of printing. (d) The social services district shall
provide the receipt of public comment relating to the proposed comprehensive
annual social services program plan for a period of 45 days following the date
of publication of the proposed plan by the commissioner. The social services
district shall review all public comment received to determine whether
revisions should be made in the district component of the proposed
comprehensive annual social services program plan. Written public comment shall
be retained by the social services district for public inspection for a period
of at least three years. Notes
